alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 02 at 5:26PM CDT until May 02 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Tornado Warning for... West central Grady County in central Oklahoma... Southeastern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 526 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Cement, moving northeast at 25 mph. There is a second area of rotation near Cyril. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Alex, Verden, Cement, Amber, Norge, Tabler, Agawam, Ninnekah and Laverty. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 65 and 89. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
